intro: Corydalis livida var. denticulatocristata, commonly known as the toothed crested corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has slender, ascending stems with lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
